関連科目:
None but strong English language skills and an interest in International Relations are recommended.
***Important***This whole course is designed to prepare students for the Japanese English Model United Nations from July 13 to July 15th off-campus (At Kindai University in Osaka). There will be a small cost involved to attend JEMUN. Although technically optional and no marks are awarded for actually attending JEMUN, the focus of the course is to go to the conference. JEMUN has already allotted 12 spots for students in this class so please do not take the spot of another student if you do not plan to attend the conference. Conversely, if you would like to attend JEMUN but cannot take this class we likely can arrange for you to participate without taking this class. If you would like to be included in the KGU JEMUN group please contact the instructor as early in the semester as possible.
授業の概要・背景: The United Nations, its connected organizations, and other international organizations have a large influence on International Relations. This course will show the history and structure of these organizations and how they relate to one another. Students will also participate in a simulation of the United Nations to better understand the functions and procedures it uses.
授業方法: 英文欄参照/Refer to the following.

第1回:
All 14 sessions are conducted Face to face
This course and JEMUN orientation.
History of the UN.
Basic IR theory.
第2回:
Structure of the UN.
Other UN organizations.
Other international organizations.
第3回:
Review of UN, IR, and international organizations.
Test on UN, IR, and other international organizations.
第4回:
Introduction to the concept of the nation-state and its place in the international order.
How to research a country and make a country profile.
Actual countries for the JEMUN assigned.
第5回:
Refining research.
Writing a country paper.
Making a country profile presentation.
第7回:
What is an issue position paper?
Common International issues.
Assign actual issues if possible.
第10回:
Issue Position presentation.
Issue Position paper due.
第14回:
Review of class materials.
Class surveys and other class business.
Final JEMUN preparation.
